Functions of fortrace¶

Currently a selected group of applications is supported by the fortrace framework. An overview can be seen in the following table:

Function Protocol Windows 7/10 Ubuntu
Firefox Browse URL HTTP/HTTPS Yes Yes
Firefox Click Element HTTP/HTTPS Yes Yes
Firefox Download HTTP/HTTPS Yes Yes
Thunderbird receive Email POP3/IMAP/IMAPS Yes Yes
Thunderbird send Email SMTP/SMTPS Yes Yes
Thunderbird fill mailbox file
Yes Yes
VeraCrypt create container
Yes Not tested
VeraCrypt un-/mount container
Yes Not tested
Execute console commands
Yes Yes
Change system clock
Yes Yes
Multiuser capability
Yes No
SSH connection/file transfer SSH/SFTP Yes Yes
SMB file transfer SMB Yes Yes
IPP print job IPP Yes Yes

Firefox¶

class fortrace.application.webBrowserFirefox.WebBrowserFirefoxVmmSide(guest_obj, args)[source]¶

This class is a remote control on the host-side to control a real browser running on a guest. Supported browsers on the guest is Mozilla Firefox. For more details to the correspond guest-side module look into webBrowserFirefox_guest_side.

browse_to(url)[source]¶

Sends a url to the associated webBrowserFirefox running on the guest. @param url: URL to load.

browse_to_link_number(link_number)[source]¶

Call the <linkNumber> link on the current website in the browser. @param link_number: number of the link on this website to call.

close()[source]¶

Sends a command to close a webBrowserFirefox on the associated guest.

facebook_login(username, password, id)[source]¶

Sends a command to call facebook.com and login. @param username: facebook username. @param password: facebook password.

open(url)[source]¶

Sends a command to open a webBrowserFirefox on the associated guest.

@param url: Website to open.

send_keys_to_browser_element(element, keys)[source]¶

Send keys to a specific element on the currently parsed website. @param element: element to search for. @param keys: string for the element

class fortrace.utility.marionette_helper.MarionetteHelper(firefox_path, logger=None)[source]¶

Helper for starting firefox and for remote browsing

back()[source]¶

Go a page backward

click_element_by_class_name(html_class_name)[source]¶

Click on first element via class name

click_element_by_css_selector(css_selector)[source]¶

Click on first element via css selector

click_element_by_id(html_id)[source]¶

Click on first element via element id

click_element_by_link_text(html_link_text)[source]¶

Click on first element via link text

click_element_by_name(html_name)[source]¶

Click on first element via element name

click_element_by_tag_name(html_tag_name)[source]¶

Click on first element via tag name

click_element_by_xpath(xpath)[source]¶

Click on first element via xpath

close_tab()[source]¶

Close the current tab

close_window()[source]¶

Close the current window

follow_link(index=0)[source]¶

Click on a link

forward()[source]¶

Go a page forward

get_current_window_index()[source]¶

Get current windows index

navigate_to_url(url)[source]¶

Open an url in format of http[s]://example.com

new_tab()[source]¶

Open a new empty tab

new_window()[source]¶

Open a new empty window

quit_firefox()[source]¶

Close the firefox process and close marionette session

run_firefox()[source]¶

Start the firefox process

select_window(index)[source]¶

Switch window via index

send_keys_to_element_by_name(name, text)[source]¶

Sends text to an element via name

Thunderbird¶

class fortrace.application.mailClientThunderbird.MailClientThunderbirdVmmSide(guest_obj, args)[source]¶

This class is a remote control on the host-side to control a real <MailClient> running on a guest.

add_imap_account(imap_server, smtp_server, email_address, username, full_name, socket_type=3, socket_type_smtp=2, auth_method_smtp=3)[source]¶

Adds a imap account to the profile.

Parameters:
  • imap_server – address of the pop3 mailserver
  • smtp_server – address of the smtp server
  • email_address – the accounts email address
  • username – username of the mail server, usually the email address
  • full_name – the account owners full name
  • socket_type – 0 No SSL, 1 StartTLS, 2 SSL/TLS
  • auth_method – corresponds to the password exchange method, has the same methods for smtp
add_pop3_account(pop_server, smtp_server, email_address, username, full_name, smtp_description, socket_type=3, auth_method=3, socket_type_smtp=3, auth_method_smtp=3)[source]¶

Adds a pop3 account to the profile.

Parameters:
  • pop_server – address of the pop3 mailserver
  • smtp_server – address of the smtp server
  • email_address – the accounts email address
  • username – username of the mail server, usually the email address
  • full_name – the account owners full name
  • smtp_description – desription for the smpt server
  • socket_type – 0 No SSL, 1 StartTLS, 2 SSL/TLS
  • auth_method – corresponds to the password exchange method, pop supports other methods than imap
  • auth_method_smtp – corresponds to the password exchange method for the smtp server
close()[source]¶

Sends a command to close a MailClient on the associated guest.

open()[source]¶

Sends a command to open a MailClient on the associated guest.

run_for(timeout)[source]¶
Run Thunderbird for a limited amount of time to generate folders and files or to receive mail.

Call this after making changes to the profile config.

Bug: Don’t call this method it will fail since the backend uses incorrect parameters for calling mozrunner.

Parameters:timeout –
send_mail(receiver, subject, message, attachment_path_list=None)[source]¶

Send an email via the mailClient.

Note: A bug prevents this from working inside an open thunderbird application.
Close all thunderbird windows before using this method.

@param receiver: Receiver for this email. @param subject: Subject for this email. @param message: Message for this email. @param attachment_path_list: (Optional) list of paths for files to attach to the mail.

@return: No return value.

set_session_password(password)[source]¶

Set password for password dialogs in current session.

Note: Call this as the first method after opening the mail plugin to prevent profile generation issues.
Use an empty password if you have to. The password will be saved inside the thunderbird profile, make sure to delete it if you dont intent to share it.
Parameters:password –

VeraCrypt (command-line)¶

class fortrace.application.veraCryptWrapper.VeraCryptWrapperVmmSide(guest_obj, args)[source]¶

This class is a remote control on the host-side to control a real <skeleton> running on a guest.

close()[source]¶

Sends a command to close a VeraCryptWrapper on the associated guest.

copyToContainer(src, dst)[source]¶

copy to an encrypted container with veracrypt

createContainer(executable, path, size, password, hash='sha512', encryption='serpent', filesystem='FAT')[source]¶

Creates an encrypted container with veracrypt

dismountContainer(executable, mount_point)[source]¶

unmount an encrypted container with veracrypt

mountContainer(executable, path, password, mount_point)[source]¶

Mounts an encrypted container with veracrypt

open()[source]¶

Sends a command to open a VeraCryptWrapper on the associated guest.

This class is a remote control on the host-side to control a real <userManagement> running on a guest.

Creating a User on the guest system

close()[source]¶

Sends a command to close a <userManagement> on the associated guest.

open()[source]¶

Sends a command to open a userManagement on the associated guest.

Reporter¶

The Reporter class has been added to the framework for different reasons.

class fortrace.core.reporter.Reporter[source]¶

This class is responsible for the creation of a report for a case added by Thomas Schaefer in 2019

add(tag, text)[source]¶

Adding the given text to the tag-array in order to later add them to the ElementTree. :param tag: XML tag name :param text: value to add to the XML file :return:

generate()[source]¶

Writing ElementTree (ET) to an XML file and changing rights to the file. This file can then be viewed with report.html. :return:

generateTags()[source]¶

Adding the needed tags and values to the ElementTree (ET) to write them to a file. :return:
